events.message: Customer reported an auto accident involving a rear-end collision on highway 50, resulting in vehicle damage.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after verifying keywords related to vehicle collision in the report.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer with the auto claim process and documentation.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment email confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and next steps.
Customer was asked to submit photos of the damaged car, police report, and driver’s license for claim verification.
The customer submitted all requested documents including photos and the official police report related to the accident.
The claims investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and interviewing involved parties to assess fault.
Investigation concluded determining partial liability of the other driver and confirming damage assessment.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover repair costs and minor medical expenses resulting from the auto accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the timely settlement offer and appreciated the handling of their vehicle claim.
Following acceptance of the settlement, the claim was officially approved by the insurance claims manager.
Payment covering the agreed settlement amount was issued to the customer’s account for vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim was closed after confirming receipt of payment and completion of vehicle repairs.
All documentation and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived according to company policy.
